intro: Kandis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with flowers that come in a variety of colors such as purple, pink, and white. Kandis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ability to thrive in controlled environments has made it a favored ornamental plant worldwide.
